ISSUE.TITLE: Bug: Error popup when clearing a number field for a row in a postgres database
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this ### Steps to reproduce ? 1. create database with postgres 2. create a column with `Number` type. 3. create a row and enter a number value. 4. clear the number entry to "" and hit enter. ### Desired Behavior It should clear the value without error. ### Project Details ``` Node: **v16.17.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.100.2** ``` ### Attachements

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: fix(gui): encode id to escape special chars in url re #4704 Signed-off-by: Pranav C <pranavxc@gmail.com>

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix(gui): treat empty string as null for number fields re #4701 Signed-off-by: Pranav C <pranavxc@gmail.com>
